column5: Great report TJ.  Very nice pics.
Great report, looked like a good time...

Ah yes, Kesagami, It brings back memories....Some great, some good, some not so good. It's definitely one of Ontarios premier fly in lodges and it looks as though their policies have improved the fishing over the last 15 years. Thanks for the report TJ, looks like you two had a fun time (but then you always look like you're having a blast ). You guys sure get around, first B.C., now Kesagami.....where are ya going next?
Great report TJ. Looks like a great time up there. Thanks for all the great pics.
Excellent report! Thanks for sharing and looking forward to seeing the video clips too!  As the saying goes...you get what you pay for! Glad to hear this wasn't an AK type of experience.  Tony

Thanks guys!!!  BPS: ya she kicked my ass again.. I think she pays a bit more attention than I do.. lol..  (small man.. small brain.. not very focused!!)  Fishonthebrain:  Of course any lodge thats an hour to fly-in and has the staff facilties that Kesagami does is gonna cost some dough...  Moosebunk:  Im not sure if he will be back.. he left the same morning we did...  and secrecy.. lol.. he knew better!!  and .... take a pee... it will go away... LOLOLOLOL  Gerritt:  The one thing thats obvious from the time you get there.. your satisfaction is thier #1 goal.. which generally isnt too hard to achieve when the fishing is not really a concern...  Joey:  Ya... as Jimmy Walker would say... shes lookin' good!!  LOL  There were bunk beds in the Cabins.. which seemed to suit her just fine.. I think shes getting sick of me hoggin the blankets...  ccmt:  man..  I tell ya....  if Im not mistaken, the largest pickerels of the year were always over 30"...  Nemo.. thanks for the link... its quite a coincidence... lol.. I nosed over in '83 as well with minor damage!!!!  Lunker:  YES...  acutally... I caught a stick... whichj helped me catch a fish....  you'll have to wait for the video of that!!  Taper... you won't be dissapointed...  Danbo... We do. I will.   Theres a sign at the lodge that says something to the effect of:  "No time spent fishing will be deducted form your life..." or something like that... lol.. personally I think some of my trips are helping to shorten it... ah well....  Greencoach... ya well I had to expain that to those folks fro Alabama as well...  I think they got it though....  It told them it was a subspecies of Walleye only found north of the border...  Lew: Thanks, no muskies up there... but the prime rib will take the sting outta it for ya!!  Misfish and Maureen:  Yes it certainly was...  Bigbuck...  Italo was very nice and congenial in person.. they were up there filming a piece with this family that won a trip from Ontario Travel (gov't)   and If I could cathc the one... I'm sure he did a bit better....  Solopaddler:  Its up to Matachewan shortly, then a wedding and then The OFC G2G... after that its a week in New York City with the kids.. but most of July and August will be up at the camp... um... refurbishing...
Awesome TJ!  Can't even imagine a trip like that!  That sunset shot...simply amazing!   Monique...go girl!!   Thank you for sharing this.....  Next time you will get him TJ!!   bly

FANTASTIC!!!!  :clapping:  :thumbsup_anim:  Although I won't be at the main lodge, it's nice to hear about the service you got.  We're up to Floodwood Lake, one of their outpost camps at the end of June.  Yea I know that I'll be missing Lakair.  The fly-in seemed to good to pass up and after reading your report TJ and talking to my buddy about his trip in a couple of weeks ago, I think I may have made the right choice, maybe not.  Report to come!  Thanks for putting together one awesome report TJ!
Great report TJ. Hope to get up there one day...
WOW!  Other than that I am speechless.
Lookin' very good TJ.   Sounds like a load of fun.

Great report...  Man i miss that place, went up in '97... the ribs WOW!!... and the people were great, best fishing i'll ever do i'm sure and it was the 2nd to last fishing trip with my Grandpa... brings back some great memories for sure!!  They still offer the portage into that small little lake on the same side as the lodge?

Kesagami.  I have always dreamed of going.  You just shot all the pucks in the net, and left the rest for us to score that same goal one day.  Thanks for lending hope to get to that better place, and inspiring us to get out and fish!  After reading that, I am feeling the need to take the day off work tomorrow and start my weekend early!  Thanks again for the fantastic read!
GREAT REPORT TJ..  ....amazing fishing trip,and adventure,  thanks for making us feel like we were there,great pics  s as well.....cheers
Great stuff TJ and Monique !  ..and you look soooo thrilled he has his hand on your shoulder!  Chinese.....every Wednesday night my friend...every Wednesday night ! We have our own table in there....
Great report TJ! And way to go Monique on the fishing clinic.  Sounds like a great trip, I'd like to go on one of those fly-in trips one of these days...  Mike
That's awesome TJ and Monique!  Kesagami is definitely on my list.  Cheers, ben.
GREAT report TJ!! Now that's what a trip is supposed to be like. Congratulations Monique on kicking his butt again!

Great read.      Excellent report and pics TJ!!      Thanks for sharing.  It looks like everyone had a great time.  I would like to do a flyin at Kesagami Lake someday.  Better start saving now.  FOTB

Ohhhhh brother.  I got 5 days in there at the end of the month and you just gave me about a 3 week woody until then.  Sure hope Rob is still in there come then.  Told him I want a day and a couple pints with him.  Good fella.  Did he swear you to secrecy on his big pike spots or what???  Great report TJ.  It's hard not to love anything coming out of that lake, it's a gem, and there's a reason why they advertise it as an experience.
one day ! that is truly a dream trip, glad you had fun

holy crap...!!!! I think I just *#*# myself... that is an amazing report! thank you TJ and give that wife of yours a high five... for out fishing you again!  Nice to see some customer service!! given some of the reports as of late  I might have to give this place a look! I have to plan one huge trip and soon... father-in-law is going blind due to Age Related mascular degeneration (sp?).. and based upon your report... I will put it up there!   wow an amazing report thank you for sharing!   Gerritt.
Spectacular report TJ.  Very nicely done and it sounds like a wonderful place to go.  Lookin good as usual Monique  Joey

I almost fell off my chair...I thought it read he got a 38" Pickeral!!! LOL.  TJ and Monique...it looked like a fantastic trip...I'm envious!! Thanks for all the great pics and story...I'd love the opportunity to experience what you guys did...maybe after the kids are all grown up and out of school...so it's looking around the year 2020 for me....haha.
Nice report.  I need to get up there
Amazing report T.J., looks like a spot I would like to fish one day and the lodge looks great too.
Sounds like an incredible trip TJ thanks for the great pics even better descriptions.
Great report and pics TJ. Thanks for sharing the Kesagami experience.
Wow.....what a great trip!
Hey TJ Nice Report here's the details on your DH Beaver   http://www.dhc-2.com/id506.htm
fun report!  Looks like a great time!  Cheers!  P.S  did you catch a fish?
Great report TJ. That is the lodge that I thought about taking my father to, and you just reaffirmed my choice.
Truly awesome! I'm dreaming of a trip like that now too! Love the shot from the cockpit as you approached the lake! That moose is hilarious too! Some folks sure know how to live! Fish on!!
Excellent report and pics!!! Those Pickeral kinda look like Walleyes...
Incredible stuff TJ and it's great to hear the trip went as well as you'd hoped it would !!  Always good to read stories like that 1st thing in the A.M.
Thats a real nice read as Lew said,and great pic,s to. Trip of a life time indeed.  TFS
Excellent report TJ. that's a trip I wouldn't mind taking one day.  Maureen

That looks like the kinda spot I'd like to take the Mrs. to in a couple of years when our rugrats grow up enough for mommy and daddy to take off for a few days on their own. Did Italo catch any fish himself?? LOL
Wow....great report and pics. Thanks for sharing.  Jason
